channel.title: Netherlands, becoming a communist country?
channel.description:
Well, I don't think many folks here know much about the Netherlands. But recently there have been some discussions about lowering the salaries of CEO's of big companies. But the ministers in our country obviously don't understand the effects of it. If the CEO's don't get the amount of money as they can get in other countries, they'll just move the offices to a different country where they can get the salary they deserve. The result is that loads of people lose their jobs, and the state looses taxes aswell because the more you earn the more you pay. You might think: They don't deserve millions a year, but think about the responsibility's they have. And they run commercial companies, don't they?
The title is exaggerated, but this is a simple example of the down side of left wing people in the government.
Discuss your political statements here!

item.title: Netherlands, becoming a communist country?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

rabcarl:

I think that by trying to please everybody and over-obsessing about individual rights some of these people who take socialist positions are losing sight of things that are more important such as economy, jobs, etc.

Individual rights are easy, it takes more effort for the governments to take them away, which they do on purpose and fully knowing what they are doing, than it does to let us keep them.
